com.clratm.unittest

Enum Tester

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Tester>
      • com.clratm.unittest.Tester
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Tester>

    public enum Tester
extends java.lang.Enum<Tester>
    This class handles all of the front-end testing functionality.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Alexander Meijer and Christopher Rung

    • Field Detail

      • input_expected

        private java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,Result> input_expected
        Stores the input-output relationship.

      • name

        private final java.lang.String name
        The name of the tester

      • num

        private final int num
        The number of the tester. This can be any number from 0 to 5, which is an arbitrary design choice.

      • notUsed

        private java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,Result> notUsed
        Stores the inputs that haven't been loaded yet. This will initially mirror expectedHash_inObject.

      • identifiers

        private java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> identifiers
        Uniquely identifies each expected output in a function

      • used

        private java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,Result> used
        Stores the inputs that have been tested

      • expectedHash_inObject

        private java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,Result> expectedHash_inObject
        Stores all expected outputs we are looking for. If we log a hash that matches one in here, we know that that case has been covered. That mapping will then be removed from this, and the object will be added to the covered list. Thus, the objects that remain in this list at the end of execution are the ones that have not been tested.

      • mutex

        private final java.lang.Object mutex
        Assists with thread safety

      • active

        private boolean active
        Flag that determines whether the tester class is active. If this is false, all possible efforts should be made to minimize the effect of the disabled tester on the runtime. Covers the "Be globally controlled so it is simple to enable or disable" condition stipulated by the contest description.

      • columnWidth

        private static final int columnWidth
        Determines the width of the class, method, input, output, and expected output columns of the result report, as well as the width of the class and method output columns of the coverage report. Default is 30.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • resultReportColumnWidth

        private static final java.lang.String resultReportColumnWidth
        Determines the result report's column width.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • coverageReportColumnWidth

        private static final java.lang.String coverageReportColumnWidth
        Determines the coverage report's column width.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • enable

        public boolean enable(boolean active)
        Enables the tester. This instantiates every HashMap that is used later.
        Parameters:
        active - if true, enables the tester
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • toBytesWithSignature

        private byte[] toBytesWithSignature(java.lang.Object toSign,
                          boolean useThreadId)
                             throws UnIdentifiableException
        Converts an object to its binary representation using the byteify function and adds the result to a byte array along with its method name and calling class name.
        Parameters:
        toSign - the object to convert
        useThreadId - if true, include the thread ID in the byte array.
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the byte representation of toSign
        Throws:
        UnIdentifiableException

      • input

        public boolean input(java.lang.Object expectedInput,
            java.lang.Object expectedResult)
              throws UnIdentifiableException
        Inputs an expected value to the tester. This will result in the object's toString method being called to get report information, but otherwise analogous to the BuiltInTester.expecting() function in the example code.
        Parameters:
        expectedInput - An expected value of the input object.
        expectedResult - The expected object that will be logged later in the code
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        UnIdentifiableException

      • load

        public boolean load(java.lang.Object actualObject)
             throws UnIdentifiableException
        Inputs the actual value into the tester. This is used to establish the expected outcome of the segment of code.
        Parameters:
        actualObject - The actual input object that will be run through the code. This is analogous to the inputValue in the example code.
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        UnIdentifiableException

      • log

        public boolean log(java.lang.Object toLog)
            throws UnIdentifiableException
        Detect an input then search for it in the expectedHash_inObject Map. If we find it, we load the expected result, hash it along with the calling function String and the thread ID, and then store it in our expectedHash_serializedObject map
        Parameters:
        toLog - the to log
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        UnIdentifiableException

      • printResultReport

        public boolean printResultReport(java.io.File outFile,
                        boolean verbose)
                          throws UnIdentifiableException,
                                 java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                 java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Prints the result report to a file, which shows the time of the test, class tested, method tested, input value, output value, expected output value, and whether or not the test passed.
        Parameters:
        outFile - the out file. If null, print to the console.
        verbose - the verbose
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        UnIdentifiableException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
